intro: Xanthocephalum gymnospermoides var. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate gymnosperm-like xanthocephalum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in racemes, and it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
